question: Which country houses the headquarters of the "International Bureau of Weights and Measures"?
explanation: The headquarters of the International Bureau of Weights and Measures is located in Saint-Cloud, a western suburb of Paris, the capital city of France. The International Bureau of Weights and Measures is an intergovernmental organisation that was established by the Metre Convention, through which member states act together on matters related to measurement science and measurement standards (i.e. the International System of Units).
